TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XmlProcessingInstruction extends System.Xml.XmlLinkedNode

Docs.summary: Represents a processing instruction, which XML defines to keep processor-specific information in the text of the document.

MemberSignature.Value: protected XmlProcessingInstruction (string target, string data, System.Xml.XmlDocument doc);
.method familyorassemblyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string target, string data, class System.Xml.XmlDocument doc) cil managed

Docs.param: The target of the processing instruction; see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlProcessingInstruction.Target%2A> property.
The content of the instruction; see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlProcessingInstruction.Data%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Do not instantiate an <xref:System.Xml.XmlProcessingInstruction> directly; instead, use methods such as <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode CloneNode(bool deep) cil managed

Docs.param: to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; to clone only the node itself.
Docs.summary: Creates a duplicate of this node.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `CloneNode` serves as a copy constructor for nodes. For processing instruction nodes, the cloned node always includes the target and data. To see how this method behaves with other node types, see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.CloneNode%2A> method in the `XmlNode` class.
The cloned node has no parent (<xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.ParentNode%2A> returns `null`).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.
Docs.value: The content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates a processing instruction node and adds it to a document.
[!code-cpp[Classic WebData XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.xml.xmlprocessi_0_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.xml.xmlprocessi_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic WebData XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.xml.xmlprocessi_0_1.cs)]

Docs.returns: The content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string InnerText { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the concatenated values of the node and all its children.
Docs.value: The concatenated values of the node and all its children.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).

Docs.returns: The concatenated values of the node and all its children.

Docs.summary: Gets the local name of the node.
Docs.value: For processing instruction nodes, this property returns the target of the processing instruction.
Docs.returns: For processing instruction nodes, this property returns the target of the processing instruction.

Docs.summary: Gets the qualified name of the node.
Docs.value: For processing instruction nodes, this property returns the target of the processing instruction.
Docs.returns: For processing instruction nodes, this property returns the target of the processing instruction.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the current node.
Docs.value: For nodes, this value is XmlNodeType.ProcessingInstruction.
Docs.returns: For nodes, this value is XmlNodeType.ProcessingInstruction.

Docs.summary: Gets the target of the processing instruction.
Docs.value: The target of the processing instruction.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example creates a processing instruction node and adds it to a document.
[!code-cpp[Classic WebData XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.xml.xmlprocessi_1_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.xml.xmlprocessi_1_1.vb)] [!code-cs[Classic WebData XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction Example#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.xml.xmlprocessi_1_1.cs)]

Docs.returns: The target of the processing instruction.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Value { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the node.
Docs.value: The entire content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.
Docs.returns: The entire content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void WriteContentTo(class System.Xml.XmlWriter w) cil managed

Docs.param: The to which you want to save.
Docs.summary: Saves all the children of the node to the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>. Because ProcessingInstruction nodes do not have children, this method has no effect.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void WriteTo(class System.Xml.XmlWriter w) cil managed

Docs.param: The to which you want to save.
Docs.summary: Saves the node to the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
